title: How to Make Oatmeal Taste Better

steps.headline: Look for flavored oatmeal.
steps.description: Whether stove-top cooked or microwaveable, oatmeal is available in variety of flavors. Be aware of the amount of sugar in flavored oatmeal.

steps.headline: Add some nuts to the oatmeal.
steps.description: Chopped, sliced and crushed nuts work well. Try walnuts, hazelnuts or almonds.

steps.headline: Add fruit or whole berries to plain or flavored oatmeal.
steps.description: Tinned, jarred, dried or fresh fruit all work. Add small berries that are easy to eat with a spoon or chop up larger berries or fruit into bite sized pieces. Stir through Apple sauce or other fruit purees.

steps.headline: Use milk instead of water to make your oatmeal.
steps.description: Convenience oatmeal is fine made with water, it often contains powered milk, it can still be made with milk for a richer flavor.use part water and part milk if desired.

steps.headline: Sweeten your oatmeal.
steps.description: Add sugar, honey, golden syrup, sweetener, treacle or any other sweet  substance. Stir it through or add it as a topping. This will make your oatmeal less healthy.

steps.headline: Use flavored or non-dairy milk.
steps.description: Liven up your oatmeal by making it with almond milk, hazelnut milk, coconut milk or any other milk you like. Use chocolate, banana or strawberry milk.

steps.headline: Experiment with adding your own flavors.
steps.description: Try adding vanilla extract, cinnamon, nutmeg or cocoa powder.
